alert.note: Alert for Macoupin (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:42PM CDT until May 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Illinois, including the following county, Macoupin. * WHEN...Until 445 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding over the roadways in Plainview, Wilsonville, Gillespie, Stauton, Mount Olive, and Shipman. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall is not expected tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Staunton, Gillespie, Brighton, Mount Olive, Bunker Hill, Benld, Shipman, Wilsonville, Sawyerville, Mount Clare, East Gillespie, Eagarville, Piasa, Medora, White City, Royal Lakes, Dorchester, Pruett, Plainview and Miles Station.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
